title: How to Make a Small Bag from a Tube Container

parts.name: Making the Bag from the Tube

steps.headline: Remove the neck from the tube.
steps.description: Simply cut it off in a straight line.

steps.headline: Cut out the bag shape.
Fix the external design.
Find a plastic tag thread or a thin piece of plastic thread.
steps.description: Going by the measurement of the plastic thread, make a small hole as shown in the diagram, large enough to admit the plastic thread.

steps.headline: Make a ball at one end of the plastic thread.
steps.description: To know how to make the ball, refer to the plastic ball making method outlined in How to make a reminder ring from a plastic tag thread.

steps.headline: Thread on the small glass bead, down to the plastic ball you've just formed.
steps.description: Follow with the large plastic bead. Pull this tight against the small hole in the bag.

steps.headline: Thread on another glass bead on the thread on the inside of the bag (this is to protect the bag plastic from the flame).
steps.description: Pull the bead tightly against the small hole. Make another plastic ball to firmly attach the remaining thread in place (see method above). Trim off any excess thread.

steps.headline: Slip the ring handle around the area where the lid joins the bag's base.
steps.description: When the lid is closed, this will turn into a handle that can be held upward.

steps.headline: Close the lid over the button.
steps.description: This will fasten the handle in place and the bag is now complete!

steps.headline: Make a ring of glass seed beads.
steps.description: The ring will need to be the same size as the top of the tube. Thread the beads onto beading wire, elastic or strong plastic thread. Knot well to prevent unraveling.

steps.headline: Slip onto the bag as for the plastic band handle.

text:
Making the Bag from the Tube Remove the neck from the tube. Simply cut it off in a straight line. Cut out the bag shape. Follow the bag shape as shown in the diagram:Leave the base of the tube intact. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c4/Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c4/Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Cut the bag lid or top as shown by the lines within the pink area of the diagram. Cut a slight curve across the top of the base part of the bag, as shown in the diagram. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/84/Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/84/Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Cut off a ring from the very top part of the tube (the area just under the neck that you've already removed). This will become the bag's handle. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d0/Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d0/Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Use a hole punch to punch out a circle in the top part of the bag, as shown in the diagram above. The hole must be the same size as the plastic bead you're using as the button clasp. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c4/Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-2Bullet4.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-2Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c4/Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-2Bullet4.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-2Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} For the smaller hole, use a small sharp object to pierce it. You may want to leave making this until the next section (Making the Button Clasp). {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b3/Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-2Bullet5.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-2Bullet5.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b3/Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-2Bullet5.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-2Bullet5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} If needed, tidy up the base of the bag by trimming (but don't cut it open). {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4b/Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-2Bullet6.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-2Bullet6.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4b/Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-2Bullet6.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-2Bullet6.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Fix the external design. If the tube already has a design printed on it that you're happy with, you can skip this step. On the other hand, if you don't like the proprietary design, you can fix it using decorative tape.Stick on a basic shape or make a collage using decorative tape. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0e/Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0e/Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Make sure that it covers up any ugly print or imagery that you don't want to show. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/30/Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-3Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/30/Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-3Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Use any other decorative items to embellish as liked. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/59/Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-3Bullet3.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-3Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/59/Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-3Bullet3.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Small-Bag-from-a-Tube-Container-Step-3Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Making the Button Clasp Find a plastic tag thread or a thin piece of plastic thread. Going by the measurement of the plastic thread, make a small hole as shown in the diagram, large enough to admit the plastic thread. Make a ball at one end of the plastic thread. To know how to make the ball, refer to the plastic ball making method outlined in How to make a reminder ring from a plastic tag thread. Thread on the small glass bead, down to the plastic ball you've just formed. Follow with the large plastic bead. Pull this tight against the small hole in the bag. Thread on another glass bead on the thread on the inside of the bag (this is to protect the bag plastic from the flame). Pull the bead tightly against the small hole. Make another plastic ball to firmly attach the remaining thread in place (see method above). Trim off any excess thread. Adding the Handle Slip the ring handle around the area where the lid joins the bag's base. When the lid is closed, this will turn into a handle that can be held upward. Close the lid over the button. This will fasten the handle in place and the bag is now complete! Using Beads as a Handle Make a ring of glass seed beads. The ring will need to be the same size as the top of the tube. Thread the beads onto beading wire, elastic or strong plastic thread. Knot well to prevent unraveling. Slip onto the bag as for the plastic band handle.
